newsitem.title: USA: Creditors to help put up Barney's financing - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Creditors to help put up Barney's financing - WSJ.

text.p: Oaktree Capital Management Llc and Whippoorwill Associates Inc are part of a syndicate that has agreed to supply Barney's Inc with a $110 million line of debtor in posession financing, The Wall Street Journal reported in Monday's editions.

The move by the two creditors, both of which are part of a syndicate led by BankBoston Corp, could give them an upper hand over other camps of creditors in the Chapter 11 proceedings, the newspaper reported.
The journal quoted people familiar with the funds' involvement with Barney's. The newspaper said Oaktree and Whippoorwill declined to comment, as did Barney's.
The upscale clothing retailer started bankruptcy proceedings in January 1996.
